Why is VEJAâ€˜s organic cotton so different? â€‹

Since 2004, we have been working in the field with organic cotton producers, buying them directly organic cotton. â€‹

â€‹We know the people who harvest it, we know where it comes from. And we may be one of the only brands in the world that do this job. â€‹

â€‹We started in 2004, working with 30 producers, gathered in a cooperative called ADEC, in Northeast Brazil. â€‹

â€‹They all have a small field, growing cotton in an agroecological way, that we would call regenerative today. â€‹

VEJA today works with more than 22 associations and more than 1,200 families in Brazil and Peru. â€‹
How? â€‹
By buying organic and regenerative cotton at a different price. â€‹
By valorizing this work, and by working directly with producers. â€‹

This year VEJA is paying R$ 24.77 per kilo of cotton, almost 50% more than the market price. â€‹
In 2021, we were paying R$ 18.72 per kilo of cotton, and in 2020 we paid R$ 17.94 per kilo. â€‹

The price of organic cotton is agreed upon in advance with the producers' families. VEJA establishes a two-year contract. â€‹
In this way, farmers already know how much they are going to make and for what price, which does not exist in the agricultural market. â€‹

These prices include a bonus to help them implement more agroecological and regenerative practices. â€‹
This means that this cotton is harvested in the same field as other subsistence crops, such as corn, sesame, or beans. â€‹
It is cultivated without chemical fertilizers or pesticides. Unlike intensive cotton farms, each crop brings different natural inputs to the soil while enriching it. â€‹

4 to 5 members of the team work directly on the field, with the organic cotton producers. They visit them, help them, work with them. â€‹

A lot of people call it transparency or traceability, we call it working in the field. â€‹
